alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 02 at 3:35PM MST until September 02 at 9:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE PARIA RIVER REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM ARIZONA TIME /1030 PM NAVAJO NATION TIME/ THIS EVENING FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 332 PM Arizona Time /432 PM Navajo Nation Time/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Paria River. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 to 0.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the warning area will cause mud slides near steep terrain. The mud slide can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. Avoid these areas! HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding and debris flows in and around the Paria River. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding and debris flows of areas in and around the Paria River. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Paria Canyon, Paria River Slot Canyon, White Pocket, Lee`s Ferry, Vermilion Cliffs National Monument, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Grand Canyon National Park and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following slot canyons... Paria River upstream of Lees Ferry. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Paria River and Colorado River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Get out of the Paria River slot canyon! Flood waters will flow down the Paria River, likely reaching the confluence with the Colorado River at Lees Ferry between 8 PM and 9 PM Arizona Time or 9 PM and 10 PM Navajo Nation Time.
